Reviews.Title: “A Latte In Roma”
Reviews.Author: satagtbct
Reviews.Content: We Have Just returned from Spending 5 nights in Rome, We stayed as a couple in Hotel Harmony Roma, Fantastic Hotel and Great Staff,The hotel is beautiful and clean we stayed in Room 408 with views over looking a Beautiful Park, Breakfast is lovely and helps for the start of your sight seeing day, Fantastic Location and very quite, its a 15mins walk to Roma train Station and 25 mins Walk Approx to Trevi Fountain/Spanish Steps. All the attractions are within walking distance,if you don't like walking you can catch the metro or Tram anywhere its very cheap to do so . We walked and found the map the hotel receptionist gave us was really useful and we never got lost. Stop off at any Cafe for a Latte or Cappuccino cost 1 or 2 Euro's, also there are so many Restaurants or little Cafe's that you are spoilt for choice on what to eat ,Ice Creams are to Die for OMG a must, there are lots and lots of Macdonalds dotted around if you need to get WiFi that is the only Down fall I found in Rome,. ,If you need a taxi ask the hotel to pre-book you one, There are rouge taxi drivers out there who will rip you off ( As We Found out) A taxi from Roma Central Train Station will only cost you 10 Euro's to the Hotel. On each taxi is a number unique to that taxi you will fined it on the back of the Boot 3 or 4 digit if in doubt get a written receipt. There are lots of Begger's and Romany Gypsies who will ask for money keep your money hidden especially in crowded areas ( Don't be put off by this as in Every Capital City you will come across people like this) there are lots of Visible Police around at the tourist attractions this usually will deter thief's and it makes you more at ease knowing the police are there. Rome is a very safe city day and night Weather was mixed raining one minute then sun shine the next whilst there it snowed ( lol Not something you expect to see ) We got told it hasn't snowed that bad for 27yrs in Rome. Shopping: there are Expensive and Cheap shops depending what you want to buy, i shopped by the tourist area's and Haggled to get my bargains English people don't Haggle enough you can get bargains EG; Pictures, Marble Cherubs, T/shirts,Leather hand bags Belts, Purses Etc. A Shoppers Paradise . All in all yes i would go back and We would deffinitely Stay at Hotel Harmony again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: AdeleL885
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 10 minute walk from Termini Stazione. It's a pretty easy walk to, easy to find. The receptionists were both brilliant. The man working during the day offered excellent advice, a good map, as well as instructions on which bus to take from near the hotel (as well as the helpful information that bus drivers don't sell tickets, you need to get them from a Tabacci Shop). No question was too silly for either of the receptionists, they happily answered them as best they could. The lady serving breakfast was lovely, she didn't speak much English, but asked the receptionist to translate for me/her. The breakfast itself was continental and lovely!! Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Trooper81
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in last May. For that price we wouldn't ask better place to stay. Great location, small but nice room. The receptionist was a very nice gentleman. Unfortunately I cannot remember on his name. (wearing glasses, middle age). Only two things: the bath room. Its very small, seems like they bought from the camping, the TV was the same age like me (30), and only one channel was working properly. I am planing to go back to Rome this spring, and my first choice will be this hotel definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute worst excuse for a hotel imaginable!”
Reviews.Author: Dweiss18
Reviews.Content: Arrived 6-22-11 to this dingy unkempt building. the sole employee/manager attempted twice to steal my 19 year old son's passport. He refused to allow my son to keep a hotel room key stating "this is the way it is in Italy". Naturally my son was concerned regarding not only his safety but his possessions. When voicing his concerns, the idiot front desk person proceeded to ask my son if he had a lot of money in his backpack. My son wanted no part in staying at this hostel ( Not a Hotel ). He subsequently left. I immediately contacted the manager to cancel the 3 night stay and requested a refund. He was loud and very rude. Told me there were no cancellations or refunds and laughingly said there's nothing I can do because " We have your money ". After reading this review and the other reviews you would have to be out of your mind to even consider staying at this place no matter the price. Additionally, no AC or Internet. The hotel website description is totally false and fabricated. This facility should immediately be closed down. HOW DISCRACEFUL!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: Querd
Reviews.Content: i will totally agree with this guy's comment ==> [i would like people to know that he did exacly same things to me.. he was polite at start and for some reason he become a beast shouting "its MY house, and if i want i kick u out".. to be honest the best thing of this hotel is the location, nothing BUT nothing else, so i would recommend u to try avoid this hotel.. exept if there is not other solution and u ARE alone, and not couple cuz rooms are aweful.. am 70 kilos and the room seemed so tiny that i could NOT move.. also he made me pay at check in, and not forget to mention that my girl was sitting out of hotel waiting me to pack my things while he started shouting to her and made her go inside and sit at "living room" i was ready to call police, but at the end i didnt just because i didnt want troubles at last time, and am not italian.. else i would go for lawsuit..] ****This hotel may be within walking distance to Termini but that's all it has in its favour. The manager started out nice enough but then went Jekyll for no reason and turned into a beast yelling that 'this is MY house and whatever I say goes". The rooms couldn't be smaller if they tried, the bathroom was mouldy and smelled awful, the shower is more like an upright coffin than anything else, the toilet wouldn't flush, there was no airconditioning and the one small fan didn't work, the internet didn't work and the bed squeaked like it would break if you rolled over (and I'm a small person). That's enough, wouldn't you say? I wouldn't go back if they offered me free accommodation. ****

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a 6 Nations break”
Reviews.Author: travelling_matt_11
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome for the Italy v Scotland 6 Nations game in 2010, and stayed at the Hotel Harmony for 2 nights. The Hotel was on the small and quirky side, off the beaten track, but only 2 blocks from a metro stop, and about 15 minutes walk from the Main Roma Termini Rail Station. The Service at the Hotel was good, although I didn't have a lot of call to turn to them.

Reviews.Title: “When I Rome do as the Romans Do!”
Reviews.Author: SamNewmarket
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and linen changed every day, The staff was very helpful, sure the breakfast was limited but it was full of fresh pastries and coffee was served. Yes you have to walk a bit but to us it was fine

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Europeansummer2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be within walking distance to Termini but that's all it has in its favour. The manager started out nice enough but then went Jekyll for no reason and turned into a beast yelling that 'this is MY house and whatever I say goes". The rooms couldn't be smaller if they tried, the bathroom was mouldy and smelled awful, the shower is more like an upright coffin than anything else, the toilet wouldn't flush, there was no airconditioning and the one small fan didn't work, the internet didn't work and the bed squeaked like it would break if you rolled over (and I'm a small person). That's enough, wouldn't you say? I wouldn't go back if they offered me free accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: PeterAWilliams11
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful, friendly, and mostly could speak good english - particularly Nicholas Not close to city centre but buses are cheap, handy and frequent, Metro relatively close. Shops, transport links and a good selection of restaurants within easy walking distance. Restaurant Grappola across the road is very, very good - but not cheap. Rooms were clean and airy (We had a double and a single). Breakfast was a very basic Continental Breakfast, simple but provided a good start to the day. Toilet and bathroom cramped, but works well. We were Booked for two weeks, but stayed for a third (Thanks to an Iclandic Volcano) Staff proved very flexible. Their Internet connection did not work for me - but I have a neolithic machine.. Facilities simple, used the rooftop terrasse to some advantage. Situated in a nice part of the town - British Embassy garden across the Road. On a hill so cooler than town centre For a 2 Star Hotel provided very good value, would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RomeGirl237
Reviews.Content: A 10 minute walk from termini and a 15 minute walk from the Terravision stop with your suitcase, this hotel was handily located. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was as expected, continental. Why do people go abroad expecting a full English. When in Rome eat pastries, drink orange juice and coffee. The rooms definitely need a fresh coat of paint and although the shower had plenty of hot water, the shower head was so caked in limescale that the water shot out at very strange angles. No chance of having a shower and NOT getting your hair wet. However for £25 per person B&B, you got a comfy clean bed, a warm room, friendly staff and a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nickolai made the stay worth it”
Reviews.Author: mikehanson
Reviews.Content: Like the title says, Nickolai and the other staff were great. I read a review that the staff were rude, and I can not believe that to be true. The staff at the Hotel Harmony spoke English and were very friendly and helpful. We did not stay at any other hotels in Rome, so we have nothing else to compare to.

Reviews.Title: “One Star is too many for this place!”
Reviews.Author: blackthorne
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I arrived at Hotel Harmony, Rome was well in the 90s. Forget the fact that the elevator is beyond small and that reception is on the 4th floor - no big deal. There is a horrible smell that is all throughout the hotel. The owner (possibly simply the head manager) was rude and off putting from the moment we entered the reception area. We were given a room on the 5th floor. There was no air conditioning. The room had been closed up in the heat all day long and had to be in the 90s in there as well. The owner suggested we leave the window open and turn a tiny desk fan on to cool the room (that did not work). Meanwhile, there is air conditioning in the reception area, but that is only while the main boss is there! The other workers are not allowed to have it on either. The bathroom is possibly the size of an airplane bathroom - including the shower, which was COVERED in mold. There was no tv, no internet access in the room (you could only use it in the reception area until 1:00), so you better be ready to simply pass out when you get to your room or have a good book. The rooms are so small, there is no where to put down your suitcase. The photos on their website have been altered. They are very deceptive. There is basically no where to walk. We told the owner/manager that we could not sleep there and wanted to cancel at the minimum, the last day of our trip (we booked 3 nights). He said this was impossible because we prepaid and would not give any refund. There was a HUGE soccer game happening in Rome and every hotel was booked, he could have easily rebooked the room, but was simply being difficult. The hotel was so bad, we decided to take a $300 loss and book a room elsewhere. If you stay here - you must be crazy. There are hotels that are just as cheaper, or more so, in the immediate area and MUCH nicer. My wife and I walked around for 2 hours going into every hotel to find a new place to stay. Trust me - do NOT stay here. You're better off staying at the train stations on the floor.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Harmony Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via Palestro, 13, 00185 Rome, Italy
